How Artificial Intelligence Is Used in Image Editing

AI is the trending, phrase for all and business owners out there. It has special relevance in changing the way we capture moments in time and work our way to process them. Yes, I am talking about how AI can and is already revolutionizing the image editing industry.  Technology allows us to set up systems and processes that begin and end on their own. In business, technology is used in nearly each single department, starting from HR, automated marketing, inventory management. More computer software companies are presently switching over to machine learning. However, post-production of images is an exceptional story. It is usually a repetitive job, specially clipping of images, altering the background and basic retouching of mannequin or products. This makes the editing process much faster and help users focus on the creative output instead of the monotonous manual task's commonplace in editing apps. Creativity can change the complete outcome of an image. To know more about the creativity of an image editing process, have a read through our blog The Importance of Creativity in Image Editing.


So, How Does AI work? 

AI takes in information given by humans; this technology uses deep learning to process information become more powerful overtime by learning from its mistakes and gathering more information and working more efficiently. Basically, this innovation imitates or replaces human intelligence, and it’s more effective for essential tasks and ideas.  There are as of now many different styles of AI image editing software accessible. It is most essential for photographers, image editors, or creative designers who need their image to stand-out in a blink of eye. 


Mission and vision: Communicate your inner feelings

Before making or implementing any plan, it’s important to have clarity about both yourself and your customers. While figuring out the target audience provides you clarity about your potentials customers, your mission and vision helps create clarity about your business and yourself. Think about why you started the business in the first place. The motives that made your think about the need of the product and the feelings you want to convey to your customers through the products constitute your vision. Missions, on the other hand, are more specific. The represent your long term goals and describe the benefits and values the product will be adding to your customers lives. Visions create an emotional connection and missions provides a more strategies angle of the business and defines your brand. Plan them properly and keep them concise and easy to understand. All this is to create a connection with your audience, so there should be an alignment between your business goals and what the customers believes in. Also, it’s important not to exaggerate or lie about your business ideals, as customers will be able to see through if your actions don’t match your words.


Content Marketing Strategy

Anything and everything your write on your website is a part of your content marketing strategy. In a physical store, you have the luxury to use spoken words to attract your customers. In online, the persuasion is done more through the written contents on your website and this is why, it’s important that you stand out. Start with the basics. The banner text, the page and service descriptions should be to the point and they should be reviewed and updated on a regular basis. Surely pictures speak a thousand words but that never vaporizes the importance of written words. So make sure you write realistic product descriptions including all perks and quarks of the product as customers today admire realism rather than having false hope. It’s also a good idea to have a blog page where you would publish writings related to your line of work and industry as blog pages work great as traffic drivers and generate organic leads.


Visualize your Business!

If you enter a physical store and see it’s full of clutter and dust, what would you think? Seeing how disorganized the store is, you interest in its product may automatically go away. It’s the same with online stores but instead of clutter and dust, it’s blur, low resolution or unprocessed photos that make that store looks of poor quality. Rule of thumb: never use unprocessed or low resolutions photos in your website.

Focus on creating a logo that represents your business and your ideals as logo is basically the face of your brand. Design multiple banners for your home page each with a Call to Action button leading viewers to different pages of your website. Needless to say, it’s always best to use real product photos and make sure you edit them properly as well.

Don’t Stop the Contents!

Photos and write-ups are basic necessities to keep your website breathing and alive. While it’s important that you start your journey with them and always keep them on a check, it’s important to keep expanding you content collection with different varieties. Start with basic videos that explains your business to your customers. Then move to product demonstrations videos so people are more aware about its use in their lives. Other than that, periodically release infographics that informs your customers about ongoing trends, styles and other important current topics. It’s also a good idea to hold regular podcasts as people will prefer listening than reading the contents you write. You can discuss the trends in your business, the blogs you publish, go for collaborations or bring in guests to keep retaining your customer’s attention.


Simply making these contents is not enough. You need to market them properly as well. Regularly post about them on your social media (Facebook, Instagram, Twitter etc.) as maintaining your visibility is a big part of branding. Keeping this in mind, only market your brand in those platforms where your customers are present. Always keep the “out of sight, out of mind” concept in head.

Dive in with E-mail Marketing

You’re doing great things in your business. You’re regularly uploading blogs, holding podcasts and introducing new collections that you know your customers are going to love. But are you customers being updated about these regular changes? You customers are already as busy as they can be and it’s silly to assume that they’ll be regularly visiting you website to know about the new updates you introduce. It’s your duty to let them know and the way to do that is through email marketing. It’s best if you create a marketing calendar and plan your email marketing’s beforehand in accordance with the upcoming events, clearance or discount offers.

Serve your customers well

The tips and hacks we’ve discussed till now are for attracting customers to your website. But the way to making them into permanent ones is a whole another job. In a fast and fierce e-commerce world as today, there’s always competitors with substitute products who are fighting to take away your customers. This is why, you must serve your customers well. Always be active and try to respond to their queries within 24 hours. Provide an active email address and keep a Chabot too for people who prefer chatting over a long and formal email. Be it review or any other social media mention, always reply when you’re tagged in social media. Hold contests and lotteries often as these are the things that gets people excited and brings you closer to them. Being kind and polite can never serve you wrong.


The journey from being an online business to being a brand that’s knowable and likable by everyone is not easy. Then again, what’s fun about achieving things that are easy? The learnings and thrill you’ll enjoy while overcoming the challenges and becoming a known face from an unknown one will surely be worthwhile of all the troubles.
